p: To further compare the antiviral activities of CD137 + and CD137 − Vγ9Vδ2-T cells, we sorted these two subsets and detected their cytotoxic activity against influenza virus-infected MDMs. As shown in Fig. 2c, both CD137 + and CD137 − Vγ9Vδ2-T cells could efficiently kill virus-infected cells, but the CD137 + Vγ9Vδ2-T cells displayed superior cytotoxic activity toward virus-infected cells. These data demonstrated that CD137 expressed on Vγ9Vδ2-T cells could be a useful marker for identifying the γδ-T cell subset with superior activation and antiviral activity.
